data.title: Buff Nation congratulates CU great Chauncey Billups on receiving Hall of Fame nod
data.meta_description: Social media congratulated Colorado Buffaloes great Chauncey Billups on being elected to the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame's 2024 class
data.text:
Denver native-turned-Colorado Buffaloes great Chauncy Billups is officially headed to the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame. About 10 years after playing his final NBA game, “Mr. Big Shot” earned basketball’s biggest nod on Saturday, becoming the first Buff who played in the NBA to be elected.

A four-time all-state player at George Washington High School in Denver, Billups played two seasons at CU and helped the Buffs reach the NCAA Tournament in 1997. His most successful NBA years came with the Detroit Pistons.

Fellow CU great Burdette “Burdie” Halderson is also in the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame, inducted as a member of the 1960 U.S. Olympic team. Halderson passed away in October and was honored throughout the Buffs’ 2023-24 season.

Here’s how Buff Nation reacted to Chauncey’s call to the Hall:
